rules: Rule1: If the potential of Drug X was identified, then the safety of Drug X was confirmed.
Rule2: Provided that the potential of Drug X was identified, phase one of Drug X was completed.
Rule3: Under the condition that phase one of Drug X was completed, Drug X entered phase two.
Rule4: Whenever Drug X received regulatory approval, Drug X was launched commercially.
Rule5: Either Drug X received regulatory approval or, if Drug X entered phase two, then the safety of Drug X was not confirmed.
Rule6: Drug X partnered with a pharma company or Drug X was not launched commercially.
Rule7: If the research team submitted an application, then, should the FDA not be a government agency, Drug X was approved for human trial.
Rule8: Provided that the research team awaited review, then, in the event that the FDA is not a government agency, Drug X was approved for human trial.
Rule9: Under the condition that the research team compiled data, the research team submitted an application.
Rule10: Either the research team compiled data or the research team prepared documents.
Rule11: If the results of Study A were published in Journal B, then Drug X was not tested successfully.
Rule12: Provided that the research team prepared documents, the research team finalized a report.
Rule13: Under the condition that the research team finalized a report, the research team sent a package.
Rule14: Whenever the research team sent a package, the research team awaited review.
Rule15: If the research team received funding, then either the findings of Study A were presented at Conference C or the results of Study A were published in Journal B.
Rule16: Provided that the toxicity of Drug X was analyzed using Material E, animal testing of Drug X was conducted on Species D.
Rule17: If research on Drug X was continued, then the development of Drug X was not halted.

Rule18: If it is not the case that, if it is not the case that, if the FDA is not a government agency then Drug X was approved for human trial, then the toxicity of Drug X was analyzed using Material E, then the development of Drug X was halted.

Rule19: Under the condition that it is not the case that, if it is not the case that, if the FDA is not a government agency then Drug X was approved for human trial, then the toxicity of Drug X was analyzed using Material E, research on Drug X was continued.

Rule20: Under the condition that it is not the case that, if the FDA is not a government agency then Drug X was approved for human trial, it is not the case that animal testing of Drug X was conducted on Species D.
Rule21: Whenever the FDA is not a government agency, Drug X was tested successfully.
Rule22: Provided that the FDA is not a government agency, the potential of Drug X was identified.
facts: Fact1: The research team received funding.
Fact2: A partnership with a pharmaceutical company for Drug X does not hold.
Fact3: The findings of Study A were not presented at Conference C.
Fact4: Drug X was not approved for human trial.

question: The FDA is a government agency.
